Title: The viability of proximity mobile payment implementation using near field communication (NFC) technology in Indonesia
Source title: Knowledge Management and Innovation: A Business Competitive Edge Perspective - Proceedings of the 15th International Business Information Management Association Conference, IBIMA 2010
Affiliations: Binus University International, Binus Business School, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Mariani, M., Binus University International, Binus Business School, Jakarta, Indonesia; Dihardja, J.W., Binus University International, Binus Business School, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: This study analyzes the viability of implementing proximity mobile payment technology using Near Field Communication (NFC) in Indonesia and to provide guidance on ideal mechanism which considers all related technical and business-related requirements. The study examines various literatures in NFC technology and implementation, including standard bodies' white papers, case studies on pilot projects around the world, patents, recent articles, journals and supplementary books. Comparing to other alternatives of mobile payment, the proximity mobile payment using NFC technology clearly has an advantage. Not only it is fast, secure, and intuitive, the implementation of NFC opens up a new world of opportunities to be used for other value-adding purposes aside from proximity mobile payment services. The benefits and potential growth in Indonesia supports business cause for investing in this breakthrough payment service. Proposed mechanism is also in place.
Author Keywords: Business model; Mobile payment; Near field communications
Index Keywords: Knowledge management; Mobile telecommunication systems; Business modeling; Mobile payment; Near field communications; Nfc technologies; Payment services; Potential growth; Provide guidances; Standard bodies; Global system for mobile communications
